title: Kubernetes
description: Container orchestration with Kubernetes - Pods, Services, Deployments, and cluster management

questions.question: What is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes?
questions.explanation: A Pod is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes. It can contain one or more containers that share storage and network.

questions.question: Which component is responsible for making scheduling decisions?
questions.explanation: kube-scheduler is responsible for deciding which node should run newly created pods based on resource requirements and constraints.

questions.question: What does a Service provide in Kubernetes?
questions.explanation: A Service provides stable network access to a set of pods, including load balancing and service discovery.

questions.question: Which object ensures a specified number of pod replicas are running?
questions.explanation: ReplicaSet ensures that a specified number of pod replicas are running at any given time.

questions.question: What's the purpose of a namespace in Kubernetes?
questions.explanation: Namespaces provide resource isolation and organization within a cluster, allowing multiple teams or projects to share the same cluster.
